{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3664115,"name":"ScottRandallWay","username":"ScottRandallWay","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/73ab20/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-25T17:59:21.591Z","cooked":"

Just getting started converting robot to Java. Wrote code and commands for one subsystem. Everything seems to be working but the one motor I’m trying to interact with is not moving. I am using the 2025.3.2 wplib. I am using their PWMTalonSRX class. I have the port set to the physical port on the rev power distribution board. I am getting no errors and no life from the motor. Do I need to switch to the pheonix libraries instead? Am I missing another object like a bus or something? Any thoughts here?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-06-25T17:59:21.591Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":71.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503632,"topic_slug":"talon-srx-not-working","display_username":"ScottRandallWay","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25653,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/talon-srx-not-working/503632/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3664125,"name":"Jared Van Horn","username":"CuteRedpandas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-25T18:01:40.412Z","cooked":"
ScottRandallWay:

I have the port set to the physical port on the rev power distribution board

It is not based on the PDH port. It should be based on the RIO port that you plug the PWM into.

Expanding on this… this is only relevant if the SparkMaxTalonSRX is actually wired to a PWM port. If wired via CAN, you would need to install the REVLibPhoenix libraries and use the classes from there instead of PWMSparkMaxPWMTalonSRX
